item.description: Update Pedestrian Fatality; INC#1461; 08:30PM; Metro B (Red) Line Station - 6250 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; Apparent male (unknown age / affiliation / circumstances) was apparently struck by and has been discovered lifeless beneath the mid-section of an unknown direction Metro B (Red) Line subway train now stopped at the Hollywood/Vine Station platform. LAFD responders are working with Metro Los Angeles to assist the uninjured passengers and train operator in safely exiting the train, before they assist the Coroner's staff with the discreet and dignified removal of the decedent, who remains beneath but is not physically trapped by the train. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for service information. Media Inquiries: Metro Los Angeles, LAPD Transit Bureau (Incident #3774) and Coroner; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC13 BC5 E220 E229 E235 E27 E52 E76 E82 EM11 HR3 RA41 SQ21 T20 T29 T35; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Pedestrian Struck; INC#1461; 08:15PM; Metro B (Red) Line Station - 6250 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; PRELIM: (Unknown age / gender / condition / affiliation / circumstances) pedestrian reportedly struck and trapped beneath unknown direction Metro B (Red) Line subway train now stopped at Hollywood/Vine Station. LAFD responders are still seeking to access the patient. Transit Users: Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for service information. Media Inquiries: Metro Los Angeles and LAPD Transit Bureau (Incident #3774); FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC5 E220 E229 E235 E27 E52 E76 E82 EM11 HR3 RA41 SQ21 T20 T29 T35; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#0669; 11:28AM; Sullivan Fire Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IDgrge; Pacific Palisades; LAFD land and air response to a helmeted 23 year-old male mountain bicyclist in serious condition with head, arm and shoulder injury sustained in a fall. An LAFD rescue helicopter was able to land nearby, and is being assisted by LAFD ground crews in medically stabilizing the patient, who will be carried on a stretcher to the nearby aircraft for continuous in-flight care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 BC9 BP19 E19 E269 H1 H2 H3 HA1 HA2 HA3 RA19 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0273; 05:32AM; 5704 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oNeF4p; Hyde Park; Further updates on this incident describe a fire in the wall on the first floor which traveled up to the 2nd floor. There are no injuries. The arson investigator was canceled and it is being handled by the incident commander. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC13 E266 E294 E46 E94 RA266 RA66 T66 T94; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0273; 05:20AM; 5704 S 6th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oNeF4p; Hyde Park; FIRE NOW OUT: Firefighters arrived to find a two story, single family dwelling (later determined to be divided into more than one unit) with smoke showing from the 2nd floor. They initiated an offensive fire attack and achieved at knockdown in 13 minutes. Five occupants of the building safely exited and did not require any medical treatment. The incident commander requested an arson investigator to respond for the cause investigation. The original 9-1-1 call was received at 5:07AM. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC13 E266 E294 E46 E94 RA266 RA66 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1662; 10:11PM; 5414 S Denker Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/31NJNrt; Harvard Park; KNOCKDOWN: 24 firefighters extinguished the fire in 12 minutes. Their quick actions prevented the fire from extending into the attic. The primary search was clear with no occupants found. Cause and $ loss TBD. ; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E266 E33 E46 RA66 T33 T66; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1662; 09:59PM; 5414 S Denker Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/31NJNrt; Harvard Park; One story row of bungalows. Firefighters are making an offensive attack against fire in one room of one unit. ; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E266 E33 E46 RA66 T33 T66; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Traffic - Auto vs Ped; INC#1548; 08:37PM; 8539 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dzrc53; Vermont Knolls; Two patients were trapped under a vehicle following the collision and were transported in critical condition (age/gender unknown). All questions regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 3844. No further details.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E221 E264 E33 E57 E64 EM13 HR3 RA264 RA33 RA57 T21 T64; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Red Line vs Pedestrian; INC#1370; 07:29PM; 6250r W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNHRKl; Hollywood; A pedestrian reportedly jumped onto the train from the platform and went through the window into the cab of the train. There are two patients being transported: 1 in critical condition and one with minor, non-life threatening injuries (was on the train). Age/gender unknown at this time. Any further questions are referred to LAPD Inc# 4100 and LA County Sheriff's. The original 9-1-1 call was received at 6:53PM. No further details.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC13 BC18 E229 E235 E261 E35 E41 E61 E76 EM11 HR3 RA41 RA76 SQ21 T29 T35 T61; CH7; 15; Margaret Stewart

Confined Space - FATALITY; INC#1085; 04:48PM; 5917 W Burchard Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pI1TmH; Mid-City; Patient (age / gender unknown at this time) was located in an overpass void space and determined dead on scene. LA County Coroner and LAPD (Inc #3318) will handle identification and cause of death determination. LAFD Urban Search and Rescue Task Force may be required to assist in removing body - TBD by Coroner. Original 9-1-1 call received at 3:51PM. No further details.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC5 E227 E5 E68 HR3 T27 UR27 UR88; CH4; Margaret Stewart
